intro: Allosorus hispanicus, commonly known as the Spanish alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Allosorus hispanicus is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
